title: Cancer Control Month, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump declaring April 2025 as Cancer Control Month. It honors the strength of Americans battling cancer and celebrates over 18 million survivors while remembering those lost to the disease. The proclamation highlights alarming statistics, noting over 2 million new cancer diagnoses and more than 600,000 deaths in the past year. It emphasizes the need for addressing the chronic disease crisis through the establishment of the Make America Healthy Again Commission, which aims to lower healthcare costs, improve treatment access, and enhance transparency in health research.

The document outlines encouraging trends, such as declining cancer death rates and improved outcomes for several common cancers, attributed to advancements in early diagnosis, prevention, and treatment by healthcare professionals. The proclamation urges Americans to adopt healthier lifestyles to help prevent cancer and encourages discussions about family medical history with healthcare providers.

In conclusion, the proclamation calls for collective action to combat cancer and expresses confidence in the nation's ability to innovate and ultimately find a cure.
